comments:
There has been a problem with the Visual Editor since 3.1M5, I believe.
I reliably fail to install and get a working 3.1 Eclipse + VE
I have had few problems with 3.0 and 3.1 up to M4

Apologies for the length of submission: I hope the detail is worth it!

Eclipse 3.1RC1, unzipped from zip
updated via software update to add
VE 1.0.1
EMF 2.0.1
GEF 3.0.1

JRE 1.5.0_02


Simple case is: install 3.1RC1
from software updates, get latest VE

Create new Java project
Create new Visual Class: Right Click project -> New -> Other
[Get Dialogue]: Select Java -> Visual Class; Press Next

At Dialogue, create a JPanel descendant; supply a valid Class name and package
Press OK

Get Error Dialogue "Error trying to set file into new editor" 
Reason - as above

In the error log for before this dialogue, there are two entries that might be 
interesting

VE 1.0.1 is not compatible with Eclipse 3.1.  It still shows up on the update
manager because the update manager hasn't been updated to reflect the plug-ins
compatible with 3.1 (since 3.1 is still pre-release software).  Please try
downloading VE 1.1 M2, and its required plug-ins and try that out.

Yes, please step up the our 1.1M2 driver for working with Eclipde 3.1RC2. If the
problem still occurs, please reopen this defect. Thanks.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Yes, please step up the our 1.1M2 driver for working with Eclipde 3.1RC2. If 
the
> problem still occurs, please reopen this defect. Thanks.

In response to the last: I am going with RC2 NOT RC1 and VE 1.1M2, in case 
there was a misunderstanding, and will re-test.

Thanks,

Patrick

Hi reopening bug as still have problem now working from:

RC2 clean from zip
VE1.1.0 appeared to have dependencies on VE1.0.1 and does not work installed 
stand-alone in RC2,
so installed VE1.0.1 in extension location,
and was able to upgrade from the VE1.1.0M2 download locally

Still have problem in simply creating Visual Class (from right-click menu)

Errors now relate to missing ClassDefs and methods

Last error and previous are:

VE 1.0.1 must not be anywhere present. VE 1.1M2 is a complete replacement for 1.0.1.

Please start with a fresh configuration and unzip Eclipse 3.1RC2, VE 1.1M2, GEF
3.1RC1, and EMF  I200506091102.

Your error indicates a downlevel EMF.

You're absolutely right.

I finally followed on the VE download page and got the precise builds indicated.

Trying anything with the update manager at this stage was clearly unwise.

Yes, the update manager is solely for released code. It isn't for code that is
still in development.
VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.
